headline: Portfolio 'dispersion' is key in 2026: BlackRock's Chaudhuri
summary: BlackRock (BLK) chief investment and portfolio strategist of the Americas, Gargi Chaudhuri, joins Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton to explain why "continued dispersion" will be a key theme for investors this year, especially as it relates to broadening away from the artificial intelligence (AI) trade. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: BlackRock Files for a Bitcoin Income ETF That Sells Options for Yield
summary: As fixed income yields fall, BlackRock’s new iShares Bitcoin Premium Income ETF will use covered calls to Bitcoin into yield for income investors.

headline: Wrong Again: 'Experts' Keep Missing the Mark on Inflation
summary: The disconnect between academic theory and market reality has never been wider. While mainstream economists warn of tariff-induced inflation and sticky prices, this does not illustrate reality.

raw.headline: Wrong Again: 'Experts' Keep Missing the Mark on Inflation
raw.summary: The disconnect between academic theory and market reality has never been wider. While mainstream economists warn of tariff-induced inflation and sticky prices, this does not illustrate reality.

headline: BlackRock’s Martin S. Small to Present at the 2026 Bank of America Securities Financial Services Conference on February 10th
summary: NEW YORK, February 02, 2026--BlackRock, Inc. (NYSE:BLK) today announced that Martin S. Small, Chief Financial Officer, is scheduled to speak at the 2026 Bank of America Securities Financial Services Conference on February 10th, 2026, beginning at approximately 11:20 a.m. ET. A live webcast will be accessible via the "Investor Relations" section of BlackRock’s website, www.blackrock.com. headline: OnCorps AI Welcomes Former BlackRock Executive Ron Allen as CEO
summary: OnCorps AI, a leading agentic AI platform for fund operations, today announced the appointment of Ron Allen as Chief Executive Officer, effective immediately. Founder Bob Suh will serve as Chairman and remain actively involved in guiding the company's product vision and strategic growth.

Founder Bob Suh will serve as Chairman and remain actively involved in guiding the company's product vision and strategic growth.

headline: Investing just got cheaper. Vanguard cuts fees on mutual funds, ETFs.
summary: Vanguard announced lower fees on dozens of investment funds, furthering an industry trend toward lower administrative costs on mutual funds and ETFs.

raw.headline: Investing just got cheaper. Vanguard cuts fees on mutual funds, ETFs.
raw.summary: Vanguard announced lower fees on dozens of investment funds, furthering an industry trend toward lower administrative costs on mutual funds and ETFs.

headline: Vanguard Drops Its Average Fee to Just 0.06% With Latest Cuts
summary: The Jack Bogle-founded asset manager, which oversees about $12 trillion, is lowering costs for 84 share classes of mutual funds and ETFs across 53 funds in total, Vanguard said in a press release Monday.  Monday’s fee cuts are par for the course for Vanguard, which has reshaped the asset management world over the past 50 years with its low-cost index funds — pressuring its peers to drop their own costs to rock-bottom levels in order to compete.  “These fee reductions — more than half a billion dollars over the past two years — are a clear expression of our purpose and commitment to our clients as owners.”

headline: BlackRock Deepens Private Markets Push As Valuation And Incentive Questions Grow
summary: BlackRock (NYSE:BLK) has launched multi alternative separately managed accounts with Partners Group, offering advisors and high net worth clients broader private markets access. BlackRock TC Capital Corp. reported a 19% markdown in its private credit portfolio's net asset value, prompting questions around valuation practices and transparency. The firm has rolled out an executive carry program tied to private markets performance, aimed at keeping key talent focused on its alternatives...

headline: Stocks, Bonds, and Metals Tell Trump: Maybe Warsh Isn’t the Guy You Really Wanted
summary: A meltdown in global metals markets, a sharp pullback in U.S. stocks, and the ongoing collapse in  Bitcoin  prices suggest President Donald Trump may not be getting the kind of Federal Reserve chair he’d hoped for when choosing Kevin Warsh to lead the central bank.  Trump’s decision to go with Warsh, following months of interviews with a host of candidates and the late emergence of  BlackRock  Rick Rieder as a potential contender, has triggered a global reset in risk assets that suggest U.S. interest rates will remain higher for longer into the summer months and beyond.

raw.headline: Stocks, Bonds, and Metals Tell Trump: Maybe Warsh Isn’t the Guy You Really Wanted

Trump’s decision to go with Warsh, following months of interviews with a host of candidates and the late emergence of  BlackRock  Rick Rieder as a potential contender, has triggered a global reset in risk assets that suggest U.S. interest rates will remain higher for longer into the summer months and beyond.

headline: BlackRock, Pimco See Inflation Risks the Wider Market Doubts
summary: A BlackRock fund is building short positions in US Treasuries and gilts in case lower interest rates fail to materialize.  Bridgewater prefers stocks to bonds.  Pimco likes the buffer afforded by Treasuries that have an inflation adjustment baked into their yield.

headline: Greenspan 2.0: Why Kevin Warsh is NOT a Monetary Hawk
summary: Wall Street misunderstands new Fed Chair Kevin Warsh as a 'hawk'. While Warsh will almost certainly rein in years of QE, he will be open to interest rate cuts, especially with the coming AI-driven productivity boom.

raw.headline: Greenspan 2.0: Why Kevin Warsh is NOT a Monetary Hawk
